title: [K-12] Transferable Language Skill Acquisition Process Using Gamification

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental language comprehension skills and experience using digital devices
context.additional_context: Conducting language learning activities with gamification elements for elementary learners in their 20s, using digital devices as supplementary tools. Applying game metaphors similar to learners' daily lives to enhance immersion, and strengthening collaboration skills through team-based mission performance.

learning_goals: Learners can use everyday language expressions (greetings, requests, explanations) appropriately in context with over 80% accuracy through in-game quests.

In teams of 3â€“4, learners collaborate over two weeks to derive one problem-solving strategy during two mission performances, summarize their findings in a 3-minute oral presentation and a 300-word written report, which must achieve at least 3 out of 4 points on each of the three evaluation criteria: clarity, logical coherence, and collaboration reflection.
Learners can identify and suggest corrections for five or more language usage errors through the in-game feedback system.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
